overview_of_class:
Catalog Description:
Quantum mechanics; applications to materials and engineering. Band structures and cohesive energy; thermal behavior; electrical conduction; semiconductors; amorphous semiconductors; magnetic behavior of materials; liquid crystals. Lectures, laboratory, problem solving.

Course Topics:
Origin of Quantum Theory, Schrödinger Equation, One-Dimensional Time-Independent Potentials, Three-Dimensional Time-Independent Potentials, Hydrogen Atom and Periodic Table, Bonding, Quantum Statistical Mechanics, Free Electron Theory of Metals, Beyond the Free Electron Theory of Metals, Band Theory of Solids, Semiconductors

Relationship to Department Objectives
Supports 2, 3, 5, 8
name: Introductory Physics of Materials
subject: MAT_SCI
